Document.Title: Microsoft Windows NT 4.0: Dial-Up Networking Settings for Netcom Unix Shell

Content:
A Dial-Up Networking Phonebook has been created and stored in my Home Directory. From my Administrator session I select Start > Programs > Accessories > Dial-Up Networking. These are the settings within Dial-Up Networking:

More > Edit entry and modem properties...
    Basic > Entry name: "Netcom"
    Basic > Use Telephony dialing properties: (not checked)
    Basic > Use another port if busy: (not checked)
    Server > Dial-up server type: "PPP:..."
    Server > Network Protocols > TCP/IP: (checked)
    Server > Network Protocols > IPX/SPX... : (not checked)
    Server > Network Protocols > NetBEUI: (not checked)
    Server > Network Protocols > TCP/IP Settings...
        Server assigned IP address: (selected)
        Specify name server addresses
            > Primary DNS: 199.182.203
            > Secondary DNS: 199.182.202
        Use IP header compression: (checked)
        Use default gateway on remote network: (checked)
    Server > Enable software compression: (checked)
    Server > Enable PPP LCP extensions: (not checked)
    Script > Pop up a terminal window
